713219f.title: Manhattan: 45th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
713219f.text:
East 45th Street, south side, east from (No. 226), a point midway between Third and Second Aves., to the latter and showing an excavation at No. 226; the first structure shown being No. 228. Upon this clearance was constructed a 5-story building occupied by Palmer and Embury in
1936. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
March 5, 1927.
F. M. Demarest.
0ift of Albert A. Volk Co.

730300f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 45th Street - 2nd Avenue (Northeast).]
730300f-a.text:
A general view, northeast from 235 East 45th Street, west of Second
Ave., showing the Second Ave., Elevated Lines.
November 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

713214f-a.title: Manhattan: 45th Street (West) - 2nd Avenue
713214f-a.text:
Nast 45th Street, west from a point (No. 235, the daily Kirror Buildirg) between Second and Third Avenues and across the latter, to show a portion of easterly sections of the buildings surrounding Udrano Uentral Station (low building in center). At the left are, the Prirters (No. 216-226 W. 45th Street) and Graybar (No. 420 Lexington Avenue) Buildiugs.
November 1, 1928.
~.L. Sperr

707872f-a.text:
843-851 Second Ave., at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of East 45th Street. Shown is a Motion Picture House, No. 845, adjoining the
afore mentioned corner.
Pebruary 9, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

713220f-a.title: Manhattan: 45th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
713220f-a.text:
220-222 East 45th Street, south side, between Second and Third Avenues. These buildings were built in 1854.
About 1918.
Brown Brothers.
